page.description: HTMLENCODE() transforms a string in order to make it HTML-safe. Certain characters are have special meanings within HTML documents and should not be used directly. This function always returns a character string - numeric or date inputs will automatically be converted to character.

prototypes.prototype: Encoded_String as C = htmlencode(* input [,L strict ])
Encoded_String as C = HTMLENCODE( input as C [, strict as L] )
Encoded_String as C = HTMLENCODE( input as D [, strict as L] )
Encoded_String as C = HTMLENCODE( input as N [, strict as L] )

argument.name: input
argument.description: The string to be encoded and it can be a character, numeric or data input.

argument.name: strict
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. (FALSE). Strict_Flag controls strict encoding. .F. = Only the most common characters are substituted with their HTML entity value. .T. = All characters which have HTML character entities will be converted.

section.description: This is sufficient for most all web applications and allows you to easily store HTML and other reserved characters in your database and convert them on-the-fly for display within a web page.
